result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas WALSDORF was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess THC with intent to deliver (<=200 grams)

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Have no association with any known drug users or dealers.  

Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Five (5) days up front under the Huber Law.   Transfer to Sheboygan County Jail or Calumet County Jail is authorized or in the alternative travel outside the county for purposes of employment   
Twenty-five (25) days jail stayed, to be imposed upon the disrection of the agent.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
